# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in split(String(text), r"\s+"))
        if !isempty(current_line) && getwidth(current_line) + getwidth(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut fringilla nisl ut malesuada facilisis."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width = 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This `wrap_string` function iterates over the words in a given text and wraps the line when the specified `text_width` is exceeded. The example usage demonstrates how to use the function with a specific width.
